description:
The first settlers of mars are arriving soon, but the colony is not ready yet! You are the robots that are trying to build the colony before the settlers arrive. The goal in Magic Maze on Mars is to build "domes" where the settlers can live, then to guide them to their domes when they arrive. When time runs out, they are out of oxygen.

To begin, place the starting tile in the middle of the table. Deal out the appropriate action tiles and shuffle the four A tiles in a pile face down.

Creating resources: A player with blue on their action tile can always create blue resources at the blue factory so long as a resource is not already there. The player simply takes a blue resource from the bank and places it on the resource station next to the factory. The resources of other colors are built on the factories of their color, with these factories becoming available when you build new tiles.

Moving resources: Players can move resources along the roads with a color that they have on their action tile. A player might have an action tile that shows red and orange, so they can move resources along red and orange roads. You move resources from one "station" to another, but each station can hold only one resource, and resources cannot move through a station that holds another resource.

Note: When moving resources, you must physically move the resource all the way, so the other players can see what is happening. Even if there is a long stretch of road that you are able to move on, you cannot move the resource directly.

Building new tiles: To do this, you need to have a resource of the station's color on the station, e.g., a blue resource on a blue station. Once the resource is there, a player with this color on their action tile can remove the resource and place the top tile face up at the position. Place the tile with the small arrow pointing from where it was build.

Watching the time: As in Magic Maze, players have a time limit in Magic Maze on Mars. To flip the sand timer, you must move any resource onto a timer space. Return the resource to the bank and place a timer token on the timer space to show that it cannot be used again. By doing this, you send a signal to the settlers that the colony is not ready yet; they will then orbit Mars once more before landing, but they can't do this indefinitely.

Building domes: Some tiles have spaces available for domes. In order to build a dome, you need to place the depicted resources on the dome spot, e.g., green, yellow, and red. When all the necessary resources are placed on the dome, any player can put all the resources back in the bank and place a dome (taken from the communication board).

When you have built all the domes, the settlers arrive. Place all the settlers on the rocket. Then move the settlers just like you move resources. You have won as soon as one settler inhabits each dome. There cannot be more than one settler on each station, and they cannot walk through resources. Once the settlers arrive, you can no longer flip the sand timer! (It does not help to send them messages about orbiting Mars since they are already here.) If time runs out, you have lost.

—description from publisher

2019 Summer One Page PnP Contest Entry

(contains references to drinking; if that bothers you the game is probably not for you)

The end game is simple - end up with more fingers left on your hand than your opponent.  Battle against one opponent to drink your spirits the fastest by rolling dice and playing cards.  Simple, easy-to-learn game play; very transportable to take wherever.

—description from the designer

Fall of Ming: Jisi Incident is low-complexity wargame on the Jisi incident during ancient China. This is a 2 players wargame. One player control the army of Qing dynasty and one player control the army of Ming Dynasty.

The goal for army of Qing dynasty was to occupy the cities of Hebei Province.

—description from the designer

Monikers: Serious Nonsense is a standalone expansion for Monikers. It features 330 cards, written by the folks at Shut Up & Sit Down.

The brand new set from Shut Up & Sit Down also includes the MUCH REQUESTED return of the Monikers: Twelve Hopelessly Stupid Fourth Rounds! (minus "the two least interesting ones")

Calico is a puzzly tile-laying game of quilts and cats.

In Calico, players compete to sew the coziest quilt as they collect and place patches of different colors and patterns. Each quilt has a particular pattern that must be followed, and players are also trying to create color and pattern combinations that are not only aesthetically pleasing, but also able to attract the cuddliest cats!

Turns are simple. Select a single patch tile from your hand and sew it into your quilt, then draw another patch into your hand from the three available. If you are able to create a color group, you may sew a button onto your quilt. If you are able to create a pattern combination that is attractive to any of the cats, it will come over and curl up on your quilt! At the end of the game, you score points for buttons, cats, and how well you were able to complete your unique quilt pattern.

—description from the publisher

No Messing Around ... When the fun starts, the last thing you want is anything complicated. Who wants fiddly pieces and a zillion rules? No way! Matchify says ... let's breeze through the rules in a few minutes, get everyone's round the table - and go for it!

Matchify uses two decks of cards (72 cards). Each card contains 9 symbols. Each card from the first deck has one symbol that can be matched with another symbol from any card in the second deck. For example, the 'Carrot' in the first card is matched with the 'Rabbit' in the second card in the Original theme. 'Bread' is matched with 'Wheat' in the MadeOf theme. 'Eiffel Tower' is matched with 'France' in the Travel theme. 'Banana' is matched with 'Fruits' in the TypeOf theme. 'Tractor' is matched with 'Farmer' in the Professions theme.

Fast-paced Card Game Best games are simple and fast - and Matchify is a high speed doozy. Compete to "catch the match" before your opponents. Sounds easy, but when the heat is on and everyone's racing to the top dog, that's when the challenge begins. This baby tests your observation, sharpens your language skills and powers up the fingers on buzzers factor. Addictive, clever and seriously challenging!

All for One & One for All! Perfect for 2 to 8 players. That's family, friends ... everyone in your tribe. Young children will love it! They are so smart they'll see the playing field is leveled for REAL . Great confidence booster! Field day for competitive teenagers, great for grandparents who remember proper games before computers .

4 cool games to kickstart the fun times. Start simple ... then get smarter. Play Valley, Mountains, Golden Frog or River Delta. And play to WIN. Once you've figured the basics you can go crazy! Get creative! These illustrated cards could even inspire stories. Perfect for imaginary friends and cuddlies!

Colorful, Hardwearing Packaging - and Portable! Fun in a tin never looked so good. 72 beautifully illustrated cards spread across 2 decks, plus easy-to-follow instructions. These colorful and engaging cards come safe and snug in a hardwearing tin. You'll want to play this game over and over - which is why it's made to last. Travels anywhere you want to go - tabletop to car seat, airport to beach.

Just add family and friends, sprinkle with enthusiasm - and you're ready to roll.

Instruction set is available in five languages: English, French, Italian, German, and Spanish.

5 Themes available: Original, MadeOf, TypeOf, Professions and Travel.

Matchify - Your New House Favorite

The Chocobo pals need your help! Lead your Chocobos into the forest and bring the cute little pals to safety!

In Chocobo Party Up!, a game with original artwork by Toshiyuki Itahana and adorable wooden pieces, you need to use all of your cleverness, courage, and a sprinkle of luck to emerge victorious! Move your Chocobos carefully to protect and guide the pals while relying on the power of friend cards to surprise your opponents. Be the first to gather six Chocobo pals in your nest to win!

Pro Jockey is a game for 2-6 players or "Jockeys" from the age of ten upwards which brings into the home all the action and challenge, the triumphs and the disasters of the increasingly popular sport of National Hunt racing. All the features that combine to create the atmosphere of excitement that surrounds a big race at Aintree or Cheltenham have been provided - good or soft going, handicapping, horses can fall and good jumping and riding earns its rewards. Even after the last fence is jumped, the result is not clear and all the excitement of steeplechasing carries on until the winners and placed horses are past the post.

—description from the rulebook

To survive the long and terrible winter, the dwarfs need to prepare. Collect gems, fight monsters, build castles, and stock food. Time is precious, and it is vital to plan your actions wisely!

Dwar7s Fall: Collector's Edition contains:


     The Dwar7s Fall core game
     The Dwar7s Fall: Empires expansion
     The Dwar7s Fall: Royal Decrees expansion
     Game board
    Pre-painted meeples

Each player is dealt an equal number of hands of four cards each (quantity depending upon the number of players). An additional hand of four are placed face-up in the center of the play area. Turns happen in real-time and simultaneously with players exchanging only one card from one hand with a card from the pool in the center of the table. Players may only have one hand active at a time in their hand and must lay any others down on the table face-down. When discarding a card to the center to trade, players must call out the name of the animal they are laying down. If it is a pig, instead of yelling "Pig", they say "Waffles", the pig's name.

If a player has both a chicken and Waffles in their hand, they may discard them both to pick up two cards instead of the normal one, exclaiming "Chicken -n- Waffles!"

The goal is to get all your hands to have matching four-of-a-kind sets with the exception of the chicken and Waffles cards - these must be paired up  with matching features (color of clothes) and combined with any other pair of animals. The round winner chooses another animal to add to the deck and plays the next round with an additional hand of cards. When playing with four hands (having won one), you may not use the wilds. When you win a second round, you may use wilds again, but must play the rest of the game one-handed. The first player to win three rounds is the overall winner.

In a 6 player game, you play until you win two rounds, with the previous middle round (not being able to use wilds) ignored.

—description from the designer

Harry Potter: Death Eaters Rising captures the difficulties and terrors Harry Potter, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger face during their fifth year at Hogwarts as they scramble to persuade the wizarding world of Voldemort's return.

In Harry Potter: Death Eaters Rising, each player must assemble teams of witches and wizards from the Order of the Phoenix, Dumbledore's Army, and Hogwarts to fight against the growing threat of the Dark Lord. Starting with either Harry Potter or Hermione Granger representing Dumbledore's Army, Minerva McGonagall or Albus Dumbledore from Hogwarts, or Nymphadora Tonks or Sirius Black from the Order of the Phoenix, players will be able to rally a variety of year-5 characters to their cause, such as Ginny Weasley, Luna Lovegood, Alastor Moody, Mrs. Norris, Severus Snape, and Rubeus Hagrid. The collective armies and players must then work together to stop the spread of dark influence throughout the wizarding world.

Players have to battle Dark Wizards Peter Pettigrew, Bellatrix Lestrange, Lucius Malfoy, and others who bear the dark mark for control of key wizarding world locations, including the Ministry of Magic, Diagon Alley, and Hogsmeade Village. To be successful, players must vanquish Voldemort's Death Eaters and eventually defeat You-Know-Who before they corrupt and take control the wizarding world.

Revelación is an exploratory and memory eurogame along with tactical and strategic overtones. Players assume the role of one of ten intrepid explorers, each with their unique abilities, to venture into the immemorial forest and discover its ancient secrets. They will have to face each other (a lot), to cover themselves with glory once they find the three relics.
Players move freely around the board, trying to discover and memorize scattered objects throughout the forest.


[Spanish]

Revelación es un eurogame de exploración y memoria, con tintes táctico-estratégicos. Los jugadores asumirán el rol de uno de diez intrépidos exploradores, cada cual con sus habilidades únicas, para aventurarse en el tupido bosque inmemorial y descubrir sus antiguos secretos. Habrán de enfrentarse entre sí, sin cuartel, para quedarse con la gloria al encontrar tres de las reliquias pérdidas.

Los jugadores se mueven libremente por el tablero, intentando descubrir y memorizar los objetos dispersos en todo el bosque.

Players work together and use the power of jazz to keep Kenny G in the groove.

Help Kenny G stay in the groove with the power of jazz! In this cooperative game, players work together to make sure Kenny stays smooth and saxy through a hectic day. During each round, players will play sound cards to help Kenny overcome uncool events, detangle his luscious locks, and avoid rush hour traffic without missing a brassy beat. No jazz playing in the elevator? Scat with your friends and a “Biddle Scoodily Bop” can get Kenny back in the groove and keeping it smooth and saxy.

—description from the publisher

It’s a race against the clock with the Rec-Tek Electronic Movin’ Hoops! The fun is nonstop with 2 great game options to choose from! Choose to play as a beginner and leave the moving hoops motor off for an easy straight shot, or choose the Advance mode, turn the motor on, and shoot for the moving hoops for a bigger challenge! How many shots can you sink in 60 seconds?

GAME FEATURES:

Motorized Hoops Move Side to Side for added Excitement
Spring-Shooters Swivel so you can Score from any angle
LED Scoring Automatically Tracks the Action
Real Stadium Sounds make you feel like you’re in the game
Complete with 8 Mini Basketballs
Set of Game Rules and Instructions
Assembled Dimensions - 28 IN (L) X 7.5 IN (W) X 9 IN (H)

Honey Festa is a game where players compete to claim the title of Honey Champion for this year's Honey Festa. Players each have their own fields (board) and a leader pawn from which they send out numbered workers in five colors. When the sum of workers in a color group is exactly 8, the workers plant fields of that color. Certain combinations of fields allow the player to place a token in honey factories, and the player who makes the most honey is declared Honey Champion!

Humans have been gathering around sacred sites for ages, and you and a university colleague have created an alogrithmic artificial intelligence program for your masters thesis that scours the internet for information about Alien contact with earth, only to discover that the subjects of many historical pieces, and even modern art pieces are painted with the subject being a location of Alien contact. On top of this you discover that there are actually multiple different races of Aliens, that have contacted our planet, waiting for our response to see which side we will join in the galactic, but the only way to contact them must be through discovering the secret behind these strange sites.

Strange sites is a two player game where players are racing to discover the sites of alien contact, and place their meeples onto them, in an attempt to be the first human to successfully make first contact. Each player is given an opportunity to choose a faction, and change it later, then both players investigate locations, and trigger their unique effects to help them speed towards victory. Using a 4x3 grid of randomized locations, players must search for powerful locations, without giving away information, using clever strategies and efficient choices to be the fastest one to victory!

—description from the publisher

Treachery of the Paper Fox is an 18 card game where an Origami Fox is trying to chase paper birds. Each player is trying to collect a set of 4 of the same paper animals, or 4 of the same colour of paper lanterns, where the Fox blends in as a wild, except two Foxes together become useless. Players must try and manage the cards in their hand, to best collect the set they think will win them the game, but also keep track of what information their opponents have given, so as to not give away free points.

Treachery of the Paper Fox features a cute paper themed design style, featuring Origami forest dwelling animals, and paper lanterns, making it a light game and a visual treat.

-description from designer

Celebrate Simba's journey to become King with this Monopoly: the Lion King edition game. Players move around the game board as their favorite Lion King character, buying as many pride lands themed properties as they can. The game board features artwork inspired by the Lion King motion picture And comes with 6 character tokens. The more A player owns, the more rent they can collect from other players. The last player with money when all other players have gone bankrupt wins! The Lion King themed edition of the Monopoly game makes a great gift for fans of the Disney movie and is a fun choice to play on family game night.

Features:
Disney the lion King themed game board: this edition of the Monopoly game features a game board with artwork inspired by the lion King movie; players can imagine Simba's journey to become King
Includes 6 character tokens: the Monopoly: Lion King edition game comes with 6 tokens; fans of Disney the lion King can play as Timon, Simba, nala, mufassa, Pumbaa, or Scar.

Pride rock plays music: pride rock holds the destiny cards and plays music.

Features memorable moments and locations from the movie: the title Deed cards are made up of unforgettable moments and locations from Disney the lion King movie.

Includes Destiny cards: Destiny cards replace chance cards and community chest cards in this version of the Monopoly game, and they are inspired by the lion King movie.
Similar to Twelve Men's Morris, this game was marketed in the late 1960s to emphasize the survival mechanism of three pieces.

Hidden Identity game based upon "The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde"

Three to six players will secretly draw characters from a bag. All characters are considered "good citizens", except for Dr. Jekyll. Then, proceeding through 6 different stories, each player will draw and play clues based on their secret character. As these clues are played on the game board, players will each take turns going on "holiday", which will add to the suspense of determining who is good and who is hiding their real persona. All players can make accusations after successfully winning stories 4 and 5. Beware though! As Dr. Jekyll can make false accusations to further his transformation!

The good citizens are also attempting to remove chemicals (white substance cubes) from the board to thwart Dr. Jekyll's transformation. Dr. Jekyll will try to play clues of his own to eliminate the citizens and transform himself and escape forever.

Based on Robert Louis Stevenson's novella, "The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, explore six peculiar incidents while trying to determine who is Dr. Jekyll ...before he escapes as Mr. Hyde! This classic story is the perfect theme for a social deduction game!

—description from the designer

In the social deductive card game Patient Zero, you must figure out who amongst you has first contracted the virus that will eventually turn you into a member of the living dead. The fate of humankind rests in your hands. Thinking of hands, why are your hands shaking? Why is Bobby laughing after everything he says? The virus is spreading fast. Will you survive?

A simple children’s game where you are trying to build your hamburger before every other player.
In your turn you roll a die to determine the movement of a pawn used by all players. The pawn moves around a reach that show ingredients for your hamburger. There are 4 categories of ingredients and you want one of each category. If the pawn end his movements in one ingredient you don’t have, you pick the new ingredient. Otherwise you just pass.
There are also some fields in the track with a roulette symbol. If the pawn stop there you must roll a roulette where you can receive new ingredients, lose some of them or even steal from your opponents.

—description from the publisher

Inspired by a very old game called "Baccalaureate" among Francophones and "Categories" among Anglophones,  I KNOW IT ALL is a board game created with the intent of uniting generations around themes testing their abilities and speed thinking. It presents a familiar universe to the players while remaining original; unlike the games above, we wanted this one more accomplished, more modern, more complex and much more captivating. We know beforehand that it will offer players, families and/or friends a unique experience while they are experiencing intense moments of fun, laughter, and knowledge building.

Geared towards ages 12 and up, I KNOW IT ALL  is a game that tests your global knowledge. The winner is not necessarily the oldest or smartest person at the table, but the one keeping up with the fast pace and thinking on his/her feet.

—description from the designer

Wooden cutout of a donkey that looks to be about an inch thick. On the donkey's tail is a small circular platform upon which one is to place small sticks that look like small matchsticks.

From the boxtop:


        Each child secures batch of colored sticks and in turn places on donkey circle. 



        Scoring: Person who makes them fall gets nothing, others count sticks of their own color and that is their score. 


Presumably the players would have agreed on some target score to win.

Like most infants, baby dragons hate going to bed! But now Mumma Dragon has declared it bed time and the dragons haven't got their hoards in order. They'll need to scramble as fast as they can to grab the gold and go to sleep, while making sure they get more gold than their siblings!

Baby Dragon Bedtime is the world's first real-time deckbuilder. Players all act at once to move through their decks to find cards that let them peek at the cards face down on the table and then pull them into their hand - assuming they are valuable gold of course and not dustbunnies!

Play takes only about a minute but players have been known to play for hours. And it makes a great family game as kids and adults can play together.

In this Second Edition, we've changed how some cards work to streamline play and added three new cards which you can add to increase chaos: The Crash, The Swoop and the Mama's Coming! Plus all new incredible art from Luke Parsons.

72 cards plus rules.

Spiral Corps is a mixed mercenary company with a core of experts and professional troops from the Tohaa Trident as well as a contingent of human mercenaries offering their experience as alien hunters.

This set contains the miniatures, rules and terrain you need to start collecting a Spiral Corps Sectorial Army and introduce you to the Infinity universe.`

—description from the publisher

Bullseye Pizza Chef is a dice targeting push you luck dexterity game. You will roll your topping dice at a pizza crust target and see what topping you can score. but be careful not to roll to many cheese or your turn will be over. once you have collected your toppings you can fill pizza orders.

—description from the designer

In mid-1944, despite their rapidly deteriorating position, the Japanese launched a massive offensive in China. They had three objectives:


     Open a land and rail route across China to their southern conquests in Indochina and the Dutch East Indies (and bypass the US submarine blockade along the Chinese seacoast), and;
     Eliminate all the US bomber bases in China from which B-29s were targeting the home islands, and;
     At a minimum, severely degrade Nationalist Chinese capabilities and best case, maybe even knock the Nationalists out of the war.


Operation Ichi-Go (“Number One”) was the largest ground offensive in Japanese history, with 500,000 troops, 800 tanks and massive logistics and artillery support. They used their tanks in armored divisions – the only time in the war they deployed such concentrations.

Ironically, Japanese armies reached the goals that they set, but US airpower prevented them from using their land route to any great extent, and US victories in the Pacific gave the US plenty of other airbases to attack the Japanese mainland.

However, the offensive made a huge difference to postwar Asia. The Nationalists lost important territory, including scarce industrial capacity and rice-growing areas vital to their economy. They also lost military prestige and an enormous number of troops, perhaps as many as 750,000 casualties, weakening their ability to fight the Communists. And fatally, in order to do the offensive, the Japanese emptied Manchuria, leaving defenses against the Soviets there very weak, and from areas in China where they had been containing Communist guerrillas, creating a vacuum that the Communists quickly filled.

This two-player game has one side commanding the Japanese, and the other the Nationalist Chinese. A “what if” option allows for the exploration of the potentials of a massive US invasion on the Chinese coast (Operation "Causeway"), one of the many approaches the US considered before finally deciding to invade the Philippines instead.

There is also a set of full solitaire game rules inside (by Steven Cunliffe) where the active player (as Japan) competes against the Nationalist Chinese side run by the game system.

The game features nine monthly turns; units of maneuver are IJA (and US) divisions, with individual Chinese units varying in organizational size from divisions up to army groups. Most Chinese units are "untried" and only reveal their true value at the moment of combat.

—description from designer Ty Bomba

Also includes a complete solo game using the same components designed by Steven Cunliffe, with the player commanding the Japanese attack against an automata Chinese defender.

Pick a side. Place your bets.

Flush toilet or stop sign, mayo or ketchup, Statue of Liberty or Eiffel Tower… reckon you know which came first? Then it's time to put your money where your mouth is.

The more you wager in What Came First?, the more you win and the faster you move around the track — but get it wrong and you'll be heading backwards in a hurry. The first team to cross the finish line wins.

Conan: Savage Legends takes place in Conan's Hyborean Age after the ancient necromancer, Xaltotun, shatters the walls of time and space, stranding heroes and villains alike together in Hyborea. You take on the role of a mighty legend, gather your warband, and go forth to battle other legends torn from space and time. Take command of your forces, gather magical artifacts, acquire power, and remind your foes why you deserve the title of legend.

Aquatica  is a deep, but easy to learn family engine builder about underwater kingdoms.

In the game you will become one of the mighty ocean kings, struggling to bring glory to his realm. To win the game, you need to capture and buy locations, recruit new characters, and complete goals; each of these actions gives you victory points at the end of the game. To do so, you need to play cards from your hand (each with a unique set of actions) and combine them. Don't think it's simple! With a good strategy during your turn, you can take up to ten actions in a row.

You will encounter plenty of mysterious ocean creatures and take them to your hand. With their help you will explore the unknown locations and raise found resources from the ocean depths to your kingdom. Mechanically this is represented with the help of three-layered player board and the unique mechanism of card-rising.

—description from the publisher

A complete, fast-paced basketball experience with one standard d6 die. Features offensive layups, jump shots, three-point shots, and fouls. Defense is played on all shots other than free throws. A fun game with variable play length based on the time available—simply set the final score higher or lower for longer or shorter games. View instructions in the Files section below.

This game was created with the help of my 3-point shooting niece during a family vacation in Coronado, CA during the week of June 24, 2019.

—description from the designer

Cookie Time! is a fun hand management and set collection game for 2 to 4 players (ages 10 and up). The game takes about 20 to 40 minutes to complete. In this game you are a cookie connoisseur, trying to eat as many different types of cookies as possible to maximize your tasting experience. In addition, every cookie you eat has to be sweeter than the one you just ate.

However, all of your friends are thinking exactly the same way as you do and there are only a limited number of cookies. So think strategically and act fast before all of the tastiest cookies are gone.  Sounds interesting? Now it’s Cookie Time!

In this game, the cookie cards can be placed on the plate to be scored as happiness points later. The cards can also be rotated 180 degrees to become money in the Wallet. On your turn, buy a pair of cards from the market to your hand and discard the money from your Wallet to the discard pile according to the market price card next to it. Then you must play 2 cards from your hand to your playing area, either to Plate or Wallet.

Play continues until there are not enough cards to replenish the market. Add all happiness together and the player with the most happiness is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Me, Myself, and Ice Cream is a light mix-and-match strategy game that can be played as a solitaire game by adults, or cooperatively by kids. You play as a dessert chef working in a kitchen to make the foods desired by your customer.

At the beginning of the game, choose a character to be your customer.

Shuffle the 15 food cards and deal them face up in three columns of five cards each. Then shuffle a standard deck of playing cards and deal six cards into play and draw a starting hand.

To create a food, you match the suits found on the food with the suits on your cards. Then you collect it and feed it to your customer, gaining its sweet reward.

When you can't make a match, you can deal more cards, but be careful not to run of out cards before creating all of the foods that your customer wants.

Once you've created all the foods your friend is hungry for, you win.

—description from the publisher

Welcome to the world of fights and collaborations among heroes of Ayodya. The world where everyone strives to be the strongest, the most badass, and the most elusive hero. You can be where the powerful denawa, the swift garuda, the agile wanara, or the uncanny human are.
Clear the path to your victory individually or team up individually or team up with other future opponents. You can be a friendly foe or a deadly opponent, it's up to your strategy, bravery, and luck. So come and have a drink at Ayodya battlefield!

How to Play:
Each player's turn consists of 3 phases:

     Battle phase: A player may confront other players with their Hero card and Gear card placed on the battlefield supported with Battle Phase Skill cards.
     Draw phase: The player takes 2 cards from Card deck (certain Heroes have a skill that boosts the number of cards drawn.
     Preparation phase: Player places, replaces, or stacks Gear cards on the battlefield. The player could also activate Preparation Phase Skill cards.

Kitty plays hide and seek with rats in the house every day. It seems like an interesting game, but it really scares the rats.
To catch rats, Kitty not only sets straps but also pretends to sleep. To protect themselves while looking for the cheeses, the rats have the choice of working together or acting alone.
Kitty or rats, which role do you want to be?

There are 2 groups during game playing: a player plays as Katy and others play as rats. If Katy catches all the rats, Katy wins. If rats get a big cheese together or some selfish rats get cheese alone, rats win.

There are 4 phases in a round: The Sleeping Phase of Kitty, The Running Phase of Rat, The Running Phase of Kitty and The Tool Phase of Rats.

If Katy or Rats get the Goal of the game, they win immediately.

Buzz! Let’s work! Queen is the core of the bee society and bees are all busy for her. If we meet other bees, just fight it! Protect your Queen, make your kingdom as long as you can.

Players set up 7 bee cards secretly and face down in a row in the Fight Area. Place a bee card on the Support Area. Players can refer following picture. Note:  Queen could be place in the player area.

In your turn, you can: Roll the dice or Fight.

If player gets 1 of the goal, he/she wins and the game ends:

     If your bumblebee covers on opponent’s Queen.
     The other player can’t pay any more honey.

The game involves skill and luck picking up game pieces from the game board. The player who succeeds in taking the last winner.

On a game board with holes in a 5x5 large grid, the players take turns to place out the colored game pieces in random order.

On a player's turn they can remove one, two or three game pieces. If more than one game piece is removed, everyone must be in the same row, they must sit next to each other and no one must be of the same color.

—user summary

Mold a blob. Plan your move. The rest is between the eyes!

First, mold the Cyblobs. The biggest and prettiest blob gets eyes and a mouth, the little blobs only one eye. Despite being formable, the Cyblobs are not very agile, they move in straight lines based on dice roll. As they encounter smaller Cyblobs, they steal an eye or eat the whole blob. But you should keep an eye on your own Cyblobs because without atleast one eye, a Cyblob is finished! The biggest Cyblob with the most eyes wins.

—description from the back of the box

During the course of the game, you have to acquire different goods in the forest and at the lake which can be exchanged for gold with the trader. The team that first gets a gold climb per participant wins the game.

The players are split into two teams. Each team chooses an iron age farm as the starting point. Then you go out into the iron-age landscape to collect food for their tribal members or obtain goods from the forest and the lake which can then be exchanged for gold at the famous Jämtland market place Frösön. If the game piece lands on a colored spot, it draws a card of the corresponding color and does what the card says. An important part of the game is to always ensure that all tribal members have a food card otherwise the whole tribe can starve and die.

—user summary

Players are monster breeders at the monster breeding academy and have to pitch their creatures against each other in series of three rounds. 
The game begins with a drafting phase. Each player has 3 dueling cards and 9 drafting cards. Out of those nine cards, they add three to their dueling cards and distribute the rest among the other players. The process is repeated with the cards they hold afterwards. 
The players distribute the 12 cards they hold now into three stacks: 3 for the first round, 4 for the second and 5 for the third. During each round, players can choose to reveal some of their cards; for each revealed card, a point token is added to the pool (from the bank). Then players can choose to participate or withdraw. All participating players reveal their remaining cards and the highest total wins the pool (losing players add tokens to the pool). 
This is repeated through rounds two and three, then cards are distributed again. The game ends after the round when someone has gained 50 points.
The strengths of the monsters are often interdependent, so holding certain combinations makes them stronger. To win, players must use these combinations cleverly.

A novel solitaire game of dungeon delving played with a single component: a custom six sided die.  Under the advanced rules, the game contains all the familiar tropes of a hack and slash dungeon crawl: traps, treasure, leveling, secret passages, monsters, magic items, and more.

The advanced rules also contain some strategy and planning along with some of the luck involved in a typical fantasy game with exploration and combat.

Clearly the achievement of the game, though, is to do it all with a single static game component.

—description from the designer
This limited-edition boxed set contains Argoat, Miraris, and Pralaya, along with Miraris: Fallen Soul, an exclusive promo card.

Travel Agrabah avoiding quicksand, sandstorms, guards and traps on your journey to thwart Jafar's evil plan and set the Genie free! Along the way stop at the Palace, Prison and the Cave of Wonders, gather objects, make wishes and take the Magic Carpet for a spin.
—description from the back of the box

The game involves spinning a 3D Genie spinner to determine movement on your turn. The first to visit all 3 locations (the Prison, the Palace, and the Cave of Wonders) and collect a token from the locations, then reach the end of the game board wins. In your way are Jafar and the Royal Guards, which can block your path. Traps are also laid out across the game board ranging from sand storms, to quick sand, to water traps. Each player has 3 wishes that can be used for a variety of purposes unique to each of the 4 playable characters: Abu, Aladdin, Jasmine, and Rajah. 
—user summary

Hansel and Gretel is a board game set in the forests of medieval Germany during the Great Famine. It's a treasure hunt, the poison ball from Croquet, and a classic fairy tale all in one!

Backstory
The Great Famine darkens the souls of Germany's forest inhabitants.  Parents once faithful and generous have allowed self-preservation and greed to permeate their lives.  Trusting and resourceful, Hansel and Gretel find themselves abandoned in the forest and lured into an evil trap.

With faith, greed, trust, and evil on full display, who will learn the lessons and consequences told through this classic Grimm Brother's tale?

Object of the Game
In Hansel and Gretel, you seek the forest for magical treasures, gain special powers, and guide the story's characters to complete startling events from the story line.  The game begins with you hiding treats that provide special powers and treasures used to complete events. It progresses as you cooperatively reenact scenes from the story. You'll guide story character's actions and movements. On every turn you'll have meaningful decisions to make, decisions that impact how other's must react to an evolving plot. You earn points for accomplishing any of the following:


     Influencing a Character,
     Gaining a Special Ability, and
     Completing an Event from the story.


Goal
The goal is to have the most points at the end of the game.  You accumulate points during the game by finding treats and treasures that give characters special abilities and allow them to complete events from the story.  You also earn points during end-game scoring for influencing the tale's four main characters - Hansel, Gretel, Father, and Witch.

To win, you'll enable the characters essential nature for reenacting a tale filled with conflict and consequence. Understanding the story's plot and devising clever strategies that exploit the character's true nature are key to winning.


     Will you allow Father to abandon Hansel and Gretel in the Far Forest?
     Perhaps you'll embrace the role of the Witch and lock Hansel in a cage?
     Or, you might decide to help Gretel escape the Witch and bring her Gems to Father.


The unique hide and seek mechanic ensures endless variations and possibilities giving Hansel and Gretel an extremely high replay value. Regardless of the choices made, you'll explore the inner ego of each character while learning anew this classic tale's twists, turns, and consequences. The story of Hansel and Gretel comes to life in fun, suspenseful, and teachable ways.

—description from the deisgner

The air was still and dry, she could feel it pulling the sweat from her brow. She stood in the street facing down the Cowboy, his eyes fixed upon her. She focused on him. "5 inches down from his throat" she thought, "that's the sweet spot". He hurled yet another insult at her. Some foul word to distract her.

She flinched.

He went for his guns.

She drew too.....

About The Game
Six-Gun Showdown : Single Shot is a quick two player card and dice game of wild west duels. "Single shot" is our fully playable early promo version, an "amuse bouche", of the final game.

It consists of 16 cards and a dice, is fully compatible with the final game (due to be launched later in 2019) and it's two unique sets of character cards are not found in the final game  - therefore no duplicates if you like this and want to back the final game.

Watermelon Smash is a last-player-standing roulette style game where players take turns pressing a watermelon against their head in order to trigger a widening crack in the watermelon until it splits completely in two releasing the contents (plastic watermelon seeds or water) over a player.

Suspense is provided by the use of a spinner to determine how many presses a player must make and randomisation of the number of presses required to trigger the splitting of the watermelon.

Players who split the water melon are showered by the contents and are out of the game. After each elimination the game is reset and play continues until only one player is left and is declared the winner.

—user summary

A compact 2-player wargame about the US and Russia competing in Syria.  The US attempts to strike at Russian chemical weapons in Syria without while minimizing collateral damage and trying to avoid escalating a war with Russia.  Russia attempts to deter the US strikes by disrupting US detection and targeting, disguising valuable assets, or running out the clock on the strike window.

The game involves elements of bluffing, deduction, budget management, and risk management.  It can be played with or without a memory element.  The entire game fits onto one page of rules, two pages for the map, and a half page of chits.  It requires one 6 sided die to be supplied by the player.

Unicorn Party is a print and play card game that is designed to reinforce single digit addition skills in primary grade students.

In Unicorn Party, players work together to host a party! Each guest needs a certain amount of cupcakes and juice to stay happy. By adding the cupcake and juice cards together, the player can feed their guests. The closer the player can match the sum of food requested by the guest, the better! Once the food runs out, the party is over – hopefully all guests have been fed!

—description from the designer

Discovery Duels is set in the "Rise of the Occulites" universe.

It is a two player mini game that takes about 10 to 15 minutes to play. It places you as one of Darwin's two kids trying to discover the most about the different Occulite Tribes over the holidays, before you have to go back to school.

Goal: Be the one to discover the most about the Occulite Tribes by having the most Discovery Points after six rounds.

How to Play: 
5 cards with different occulite tribes are placed in a row in numberical order (1 to 5).
Each player rolls their five dice. Players count to five while looking at what their opponent has rolled and then secretly order their own dice in a line behind their hand. This determines which card each die will be allocated to. The first die in the line will be allocated to the firest card and so on. The first player to finish allocating dice will break ties during the round. 
After both players have finished ordering their dice, they are revealed and then placed on the card they were allocated to. Each card is then resolved in order (1 to 5), paying attention to the rules that are written on the card. When  one  player  has  a  higher  end  total  for  a  card  than  the  other player, they are said to DISCOVER the card and receive a number of Discovery Points equal to the number on the card.
Players play six rounds in the way described above, totalling  their Discovery Points across all six rounds.
